Ingredients/Vitamin C

Vitamin C

VitaminsLongevity Mix
Description

A water-soluble vitamin and powerful antioxidant essential for immune function, collagen synthesis, and cellular protection against oxidative stress. As ascorbic acid, it plays a critical role in various metabolic processes.

Molecular Formula: C6H8O6

Mechanism of Action

Acts as an electron donor to neutralize free radicals, supports collagen formation by hydroxylating proline and lysine residues, and enhances immune cell function

Blueprint Dosage

250mg (278% DV)

Key Benefits
Immune supportAntioxidant protectionCollagen synthesis
Research Evidence (11 studies)

Immune support

High ImpactHigh Confidence
Vitamin C supports immune defense by enhancing various cellular functions of both innate and adaptive immune systems. It accumulates in neutrophils and enhances chemotaxis, phagocytosis, and microbial killing. Meta-analyses show it may reduce the duration of common cold symptoms by 8-14% in adults.
Clinical Dosage: See research sources below
Blueprint Match: ✓ Within range

Research Sources:

PMID: 39093088

Antioxidant protection

Medium ImpactHigh Confidence
As a potent water-soluble antioxidant, vitamin C donates electrons to neutralize free radicals and reactive oxygen species. It regenerates vitamin E from its oxidized form and protects lipids, proteins, and DNA from oxidative damage. Studies show it reduces markers of oxidative stress.
Clinical Dosage: See research sources below
Blueprint Match: ✓ Within range

Research Sources:

PMID: 39789815

Collagen synthesis

Low ImpactHigh Confidence
Vitamin C is essential for collagen synthesis as a cofactor for prolyl and lysyl hydroxylases, enzymes required for stabilizing the collagen triple helix. Without adequate vitamin C, collagen synthesis is impaired, affecting skin, blood vessels, bones, and wound healing.
Clinical Dosage: See research sources below
Blueprint Match: ✓ Within range

Research Sources:

PMID: 39458675
Safety Information

Potential Side Effects

  • High doses may cause digestive upset
  • May increase kidney stone risk in susceptible individuals

Contraindications

  • Hemochromatosis (iron overload)
  • History of kidney stones

Maximum Safe Dosage: 2000mg/day
